channel.title: Thingiverse - Newest Things
channel.description: The newest and coolest things from Thingiverse.com

item.title: Strigas Sword Castlevania
item.description:
This is the bottom piece of the Sword Striga uses to fight off the farmers as seen in Netflix's Castlevania series.

The full sword is available at Patreon.com/Spirited3D

The sword stands about 6 ft tall. I'm not sure how tall Striga is but it's clear she's huge.I couldn't find this file anywhere so decided to make it myself after watching that epic scene where she slays all of the farmers while wearing her daylight armor.
item.author: Spirited3D

item.title: Micro Swiss ADXL345 Hotend Mount
item.description:
This is a mount for an ADXL345 accelerometer to test resonance frequencies on the X axis. It attaches to the Micro Swiss hot end to give a more accurate reading of the resonance frequencies at the extruder tip.

Requires 4x m3 screws, either 4mm or 5mm.

Might fit on other hotends, but might require some tweaking to fit. Remove hot end sock before use.
item.author: Binsky734

item.title: HO Scale Arched Stone Bridge
item.description:
This is my Arched Stone Bridge. You can repeat the center section parts to make your bridge as long as you want it to be.
What do you need modeled?
If I ever fail to respond to you on Thingiverse, email me directly at kabrumble@comcast.net. Sometimes Thingiverse doesn’t work.
Enjoy.
All of my models are free, and tips are not necessary...but they are fun.
Kim
item.author: kabrumble

item.title: Elevation Supports
item.description:
A must-have for that sprawling multi-level dungeon. If you've been having fun with printable terrain in your game, but want to display the larger layout as a complete map, these will do the trick.

These supports are made for floor tiles and walls of the OpenLock system. They're stackable and the clips are removable for a future model. (The current clips don't fit the newer tessellation versions. I'll be putting out those soon.) Depending on how many you use, you can greatly increase stability. There is also a Base Support for extra stability.

Note: the clips are intended to snap in with the bump away from the beveled side of the support. It'll go in either way, but it's more secure.
item.author: ndtucker

item.title: Pokemon Big Tin Splitter Light Version
item.description: This is a light version of a thicker print, designed to be: "Pokemon tin organizer to fit 60 card decks sleeved in dragon shields, will fit up to 4 decks although the 4th one will have to be split between the extra slots on the top and side."
item.author: kuskus_

item.title: RC basic tool tray
item.description: This is a tool tray I made for my RC tools. got tired of my drivers just laying around so I made it. The hole for the drivers a sized off MIP drivers, I did over size them so they should fit other brands. I added slots for body scissors and a regular pair on the side. The left square cut out I sized for a magnet tray I found at the local parts store.

item.author: The6mmRifleman

item.title: flopping fish automaton
item.description:
The goal of this project was to design a 3D-printed automaton according to our own imagination and other automaton inspirations online. Once all parts were assembled to the best of our capability, we tested to see how they worked and post-processed our parts to have the automaton function.

Our project is a 3D printed flopping fish. We created a box 20cm long that fit the fish's body parts. Through the use of eight cams, we were able to create a repetitive bouncing motion. My partner and I hand-designed each part prior to 3D design to find appropriate dimensions for all parts of the automaton.

item.title: Shelf Bracket
item.description:
This is a remixed shelf bracket, big thanks to GO_Strawbs - Original file: https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:2999499

I extended the bracket to form a bookend with an extra screw hole to make the shelf more secure. I also created a cap to cover the wall screw to give a clean look. This shelf will fit a 160mm shelf flush to the end, the minimum shelf depth is160mm or will fit a deeper shelf.

Instruction

You will need:
3 x screws per bracket to mount your wall
2 x screw per bracket to mount the shelf board

item.author: Diogo92

item.title: BMW F series front Strut alignment jig (needs your own laser)
item.description:
When replacing BMW F series front shock absorbers /struts and or springs the top mount needs to be aligned using a specific tool (google BMW 83302210778) which costs approx. £500 /$600.

This thingi provides the laser mount (you need your own DIY laser that has a 1/4 standard fitting), the mirror holder and a few options for targets (all work). There is also a spacer (3 needed) to use the original bolts to hold the target in place.

Basically the use of the tool is simple – fix a laser source into the bottom of the new or reused shock absorber/strut, put a mirror on the shock absorber to reflect the laser back to itself then adjust the laser so that the line hits the centre mark. Then don’t touch the laser settings but keep it fixed to the strut, remove the mirror and assemble the top mount with a ‘target’ attached – adjust the top mount position until the laser hits the relevant line on the target.
My logic was that I although didn’t know where to put the mark on that target, I could work on the assumption that the factory had aligned my current shocks correctly, so I just mount and align the laser whilst still on the old shock and without dismantling anything, mark where the laser hit the target. Keep the target bolted to the top mount and progress the repair, then when the top mount was fitted to the new shock absorber/spring I just needed match the lines up again. That’s what I did and it worked perfectly - when it came to reassembly all the fittings lined up perfectly and the springs were tight against both top and bottom endstops.

I've included the freecad source files
item.author: DaveKNL

item.author: jeffreybjohnson

item.title: Fallout Big Guns Bobblehead Minigun Alternative
item.description:
Made in Nov 2019 using the free browser-based program TinkerCAD to 3D print specifically for the real-life Fallout Big Guns Bobblehead to replace the boring minigun he holds.

I managed to measure it to even fit in Vault Boy's hands correctly, however, with the settings I had used, the forward handle broke off a few weeks after printing (and I'm pretty well over 3D-printing anything else myself until the tech gets to where it requires way less fiddly maintenance).

The scorpion shown on the back wasn't really distinguishable in the final print, by the way.


Sketchfab Page

Inspired by the miniguns from Doom (2016), Deep Rock Galactic, and shadowdragon811's, here.
item.author: StygianEmperor

item.title: MTM ACR5-72 Ammo Crate Vertical Card Organizer
item.description:
This was designed to turn an MTM Case-Gard ACR5-72 Ammo Crate into a vertical card storage big. I designed it for Marvel Legendary but any standard sized cards could be stored in it with plenty of room for sleeved cards. Each file covers 1/4 of the case and can be mixed and matched and mirrored (m) to meet your storage needs.

The basic card organizer would require 2 prints of file 1 and 2 prints of file 1 mirrored.
item.author: zerohix

item.title: DnD Miniature Base
item.description:
Just some simple miniature bases to be used for DnD or other tabletop games where miniatures require bases of approximately 25mm (or 1inch) in diametre.

There are 2 different sizes

  1. 1x1 sizes are 25mm in diametre (roughly 1 tile in DnD)
  2. 2x2 sizes are 50mm in diametre (roughly 2 tiles wide in DnD)

There are 2 different versions.

  1. Mini Base 1x1 and Mini Base 2x2 are simple bases that need to have models put on top of them.
  2. Papercraft Mini Base 1x1 and Papercraft Mini Base 2x2 are bases that include a little indentation to slide paper art into as well as an indented arrow in the base to indicate the facing direction of the miniature.
item.author: cergoh

item.title: Sullivan King: Demented
item.description: Sullivan King's "Demented" Cover Art made printable!

item.title: Shell 2.5 DIN vertical DIN mount
item.description: Minimalist version of the original vertical mount. I've thinned the walls and clip to remove material to reduce the filament used and speed up the print time. My Shelly 2.5 will not be visible, so did not need the fillets and Shelly logo etc.
item.author: gknapp

item.title: Anemometer V1.0
item.description:
Anemometer - Solar - Wifi - Bluetooth

BOM

1 x ESP32 like Firebeetle, or ESP WROOM Lolin32 or LOLIN32 with ESP32 240MHz Dual-Core, WiFi, Bluetooth/BLE, 4MB Flash, Charging Circuit, Arduino IDE Compatible
1 x AS5600 Absolute Encoder PWM / I2C Port Precision 12-bit (wind direction)
2 x Ky 003 Magnetic Sensor Module DC 5 V (Wind Speed)
1 x INA3221 Triple Channel Shunt Power Supply Voltage Monitor Sensor
1 x Solar panel 12W 12v 20W or more recommended especially for winter saison in the north of Europe
4 x ball bearings 624Z 4 mm x 13 mm x 5 mm Single Row
2 x M4 40mm bolt + nolt
1 x Waveshare Solar Power Management Module for 6V~24V Solar Panel
3 x magnets for the wind speed
1 x magnet for the AS5600 encoder (wind direction) se the datasheet. In my case I used the magnet of a old defective RC chopper motor diameter 5mm
2 x 18650 (2 x 2000mA/h) Aku recycled from laptop battery pack
1 old usb cable of the desired length
6 x screws for the wind speed and direction
2 x threaded rod 80mm length

item.author: amgn007

item.title: Computer fan air duct
item.description:
Air duct to connect 120 mm x 32 mm cooling fan to 3/4 inch flexible wire loom.
The fan and wire loom that I used.
Wathai 120mm x 32mm Brushless Cooling Blower Fan 12V DC Dual Ball Centrifugal Fan High Airflow https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08P1S5DBN/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1
3/4" Wire Loom Non-Slit Polyethylene Corrugated Flexible Innerduct Conduit https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01M9A35ZW/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1
Two versions one with a side port to bypass some of the air (V2) and one without side port (V1). If the door (V3) for the vent port moves too easily bend it slightly so it is tighter in the slide tracks.
I used it to supply air to an oil heater. The side vent duct is used to vary the air output. I could have done that with a rheostat.
item.author: scottk900
